snippet: A discovery that a mosquito’s sperm carries the same set of chemical sensors as the olfactory receptors on its antennas could be used to disrupt the fertilization process.
abstract: Study in journal Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences suggests that mosquito sperm may have sense of smell, finding that could suggests ways to control spread of disease-carrying insects.
lead_paragraph: A discovery that a mosquito’s sperm carries the same set of chemical sensors as the olfactory receptors on its antennas could be used to disrupt the fertilization process.

headline.print_headline: Insect: Turning a Mosquito’s Sense of Smell Against It
headline.main: Turning a Mosquito’s Sense of Smell Against It

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences
